comments:
When starting Eclipse M5 on my machine is get this Error:

D:\eclipse>java -cp startup.jar org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoSuchMethodError
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.isAlreadyRunning(Main.java:1504)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:597)

I use this virtual machine:

D:\eclipse>java -version
java version "1.3.1_03"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.3.1_03-b03)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.3.1_03-b03, mixed mode)

When using this JDK:

D:\eclipse>v:\opt\jdk1.4.2\bin\java.exe -version
java version "1.4.2"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2-b28)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.2-b28, mixed mode)

I started Eclipse M5 using this command:

D:\eclipse>v:\opt\jdk1.4.2\bin\java.exe -cp startup.jar
org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main

Only the .config and workspace directories are created but nothing happens, no
error nothing. Eclipse does not start.

Note:
Previous version M4 had the same problem on my machine at work. At home however
M4 works fine, using JDK 1.3.1 as well (might not be 1.3.1_03 exactly. I do not
remember). I still have to test M5 back home.

Running Eclipse M5 on JDK 1.4.2 a second time a v2Config file appeared in the
directory '.config\platform.cfg.metadata'. Running Eclipse another time suddenly
works and shows the IDE errorless.

So the workaround is running the program several times without knowing what it
does on 1.4.

Only just found out that Eclipse should be run on JDK 1.4.1 and up. Would be
handy if this would be noted in the readme for the 3.0 version. Only target
platforms are noted for Eclipse 2.1.

Yes, we plan on both updating the README file (which currently states that it is
a copy of 2.1 and not a 3.0 file) and the error message that you get when you
start up.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 44814 ***
